resources.string: HearHere utilizes geometric features of sound to categorize a tapping sound within a grid. The geometric features are based on the Time Difference of Arrival (TDoA) of the sound between two microphones. By using this classification, any off the shelf phone with stereo recording capability can be made into a music producing device. The first step is to calibrate your surface. Imagine a set of six piano keys laid out in front of your device, labeled A-F. HearHere transforms these positions into MIDI controllers! After calibrating the six positions, play the HearHere game by tapping a location and hearing the corresponding sound!
